htmlBody:
Executive summary: The team at Probably Good share career advice they wish they knew when younger around being proactive, exploring options, focusing on transferable skills, and playing to your strengths.

Key points:

  1. Show you can do the work by taking on projects even without formal experience.
  2. You likely have more career options than you realize, so try different things early on.
  3. Prioritize broadly useful skills like learning and communication.
  4. Roles shape your identity, so choose ones that push you in a positive direction.
  5. Be proactive in reaching out to people and pursuing opportunities.
  6. Play to your strengths and don't over-index on fixing weaknesses.

 

This comment was auto-generated by the EA Forum Team. Feel free to point out issues with this summary by replying to the comment, and contact us if you have feedback.
